Description: Simulates cars, bikes, public transit, and pedestrians. It pulls data from OpenStreetMaps, and additionally infers details for lanes, traffic signals, parking lots, and more

Powerful acoustic simulation software. Improve the acoustic performance of your designs with this complete simulation solution used by leading manufacturers around the world.

Adams helps engineers to study the dynamics of moving parts, and how loads and forces are distributed throughout mechanical systems.

Adams allows you to create flexible parts conveniently even in the presence of large overall motion and complex interaction with other modeling elements.

Description: ANSYS is a suite of engineering simulation software developed by ANSYS, Inc. It's widely used across various industries for simulating and analyzing how products will behave and perform in real-world scenarios before they are actually manufactured or deployed. ANSYS software covers a wide range of disciplines including structural analysis, fluid dynamics, electromagnetics, and more. It's often used by engineers and designers to optimize designs, troubleshoot problems, and reduce the need for physical prototypes, ultimately saving time and resources in the product development process.
CFD software for turbomachinery applications.

Ansys Mechanical is a finite element analysis (FEA) software used to perform structural analysis using advanced solver options, including linear dynamics, nonlinearities, thermal analysis, materials, composites, hydrodynamic, explicit, and more.

Ansys Motion is a completely integrated simulation environment for both component and system modeling. It provides fast and accurate analysis for both rigid and flexible bodies, simultaneously, all from a single solver. System motion performance, stress-safety analysis, heat transfer, vibration and fatigue are integral.

Description: Ansys Rocky a discrete element method (DEM) software used for simulating the motion of granular and discontinuous material. Rocky is designed to solve engineering problems. With multi-graphics processing unit (GPU) solver technology, you can simulate the behavior of different shaped and sized particles in many industrial applications.

Features: Modelica, Multidomain, MBD, Dynamics, Flow, Powertrain, Electic, PLC, Digital Twin
Description: A powerful platform for simulating and analyzing physics-based models of complex systems. With flexible modeling capabilities and tight integrations with ANSYS solutions for 3-D physics simulation and embedded software design, Simplorer provides broad support for assembling system-level physical models and robust simulation for verifying and optimizing system performance. Simplorer supports multiple standard modeling languages and exchange formats, including Modelica, VHDL-AMS, and the Functional Mock-up Interface, and is compatible with Modelica libraries offered by Modelon.

Features: Modelica, Multidomain, Multi-Body Systems, MBD, Dynamics, Digital Twin
Description: With SimulationX, engineers model, simulate, and analyze the behavior of all parts of the technical systems comprising mechanical, hydraulics, pneumatics, electronics, thermal, and control systems. Comprehensive component libraries with application-oriented model elements ensure that they have the right tools available for each task.

Features: Vehicle Dynamics, MATLAB/Simulink, MBD, SIL, HIL, Scenario Based, Kinematics and Compliance (K&C), AD/ADAS, 3D Environment
Description: Model and simulate vehicle dynamics in a virtual 3D environment

SOLIDWORKS® Simulation is an easy-to-use portfolio of structural analysis tools that use Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to predict a product’s real-world physical behavior by virtually testing CAD models. The portfolio provides linear, non-linear static and dynamic analysis capabilities.
Stage simulates a population of mobile robots, sensors and objects in a two-dimensional bitmapped environment. Stage is designed to support research into multi-agent autonomous systems
Stride is a free and open-source cross-platform C# game engine. It is fit for both 2D and 3D games, as well as any other interactive content running on desktop and VR.

Features: Traffic, Traffic-Manipulation, Maps, Road-Networks, OpenDRIVE, OpenStreetMap
Description: An open source, highly portable, microscopic traffic simulation package designed to handle large road networks and different modes of transport.
Netconvert imports digital road networks from different sources and generates road networks that can be used by SUMO or other tools.

SuspensionSim is used by model users and model builders. Model users are engineers and designers who work with a given suspension layout, change hardpoint coordinates and stiffness properties, and then evaluate the suspension behavior by analyzing simulated test results.
Tecplot 360 integrated postprocessing environment allows you to analyze detailed flow-field data while producing exceptional visual output.
TORCS is an open-source 3D car racing simulator. It is used as ordinary car racing game, as AI racing game and as research platform.
Torque Game Engine, or TGE, is an open-source cross-platform 3D computer game engine
Efficient Optimization Based on FEA and CFD Simulations
A microscopic traffic simulator in Python.
TransModeler is a powerful and versatile traffic simulation package applicable to a wide array of traffic planning and modeling tasks.
TSIS-CORSIM is a microscopic traffic simulation software package for signal systems, highway systems, freeway systems, or combined signal, highway and freeway systems.
This simulator was built for Udacity's Self-Driving Car Nanodegree, to teach students how to train cars how to navigate road courses using deep learning

Features: Game Development, 3D, C++ Engine, Sensor/Camera Simulation
Description: Create and grow real-time 3D games, apps, and experiences for entertainment, film, automotive, architecture, and more.

Features: Game Development, 3D, C++ Engine, Sensor/Camera Simulation
Description: Unreal Engine is a 3D computer graphics game engine developed by Epic Games
Software for Vibro-Acoustics Analysis & Simulation

Veins is an open source framework for running vehicular network simulations. It is based on two well-established simulators: OMNeT++, an event-based network simulator, and SUMO, a road traffic simulator. It extends these to offer a comprehensive suite of models for IVC simulation.

Features: Vehicle Dynamics, Design of Experiments, Real time, Suspension, K&C, ADAS, MATLAB, FMI
Description: With VI-CarRealTime, Vehicle Dynamics engineers can quickly and easily perform large Design of Experiments (DOE) and multi-objective optimization studies.

Features: Crash, Safety, Impact, Airbag, Battery, Strength & Dynamics, Seat Design
Description: Use ESI's VIRTUAL PERFORMANCE SOLUTION VPS software to simulate crash, safety, strength, and dynamics of next-generation vehicles.

Features: Environment, OpenDRIVE, OpenSCENARIO, ADAS, AD, SiL, DiL, ViL, HiL,
Description: VTD is a toolkit for the creation, configuration, presentation and evaluation of virtual environments in the scope of road and rail based simulations. It is used for the development of ADAS and automated driving systems as well as the core for training simulators. It covers the full range from the generation of 3d content to the simulation of complex traffic scenarios and, finally, to the simulation of either simplified or physically driven sensors.

Features: Traffic, Maps, Digital City Twin, OpenStreetMap
Description: traffic simulation software PTV Vissim digitally reproduces the traffic patterns of all road users on a microscopic scale.
Webots_ros is a package that provides the necessary interfaces to simulate a robot in the Webots open-source 3D rigid body simulator for robots.

Features: Modelica, Multidomain, MBD, Dynamics, Flow, Powertrain, Electic, PLC, Digital Twin,
Description: A high-fidelity modeling environment that uses versatile symbolic components and computation to drive design efficiency and innovation. It integrates with the Wolfram technology platform to enable modeling, simulation, and analysis (of many types).

Features: CFD, Mesh-free, Lattice Boltzmann Approach, Lubrication Simulation
Description: Xflow CFD is a high-fidelity computational fluid dynamics software that uses a mesh-free, Lattice Boltzmann approach to simulate complex fluid dynamics and interactions for a wide range of applications across multiple industries.
